greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Maximum stable divisor of n.
comment: A prime index of n is a number m such that prime(m) divides n. The multiset of prime indices of n is row n of A112798. A number is stable if its distinct prime indices are pairwise indivisible. Stable numbers are listed in A316476, which is the union of this sequence without 1.
link: Gus Wiseman, Sequences counting and encoding certain classes of multisets
example: The stable divisors of 60 are {1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 15}, so a(60) = 15.
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Sep 15 2019
